intro: Tacazzea volubilis, commonly known as the climbing tacazzea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a trailing or climbing plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
